p: Processing, Pao Zhi in Chinese, is an ancient Chinese pharmaceutical technique for facilitating the use of traditional Chinese medicinal materials (TCMM) for clinical needs. Traditionally, most TCMM require a proper processing before clinical use [ 18]. After processing, some changes occur, which inevitably influence the associated pharmacological properties. It was traditionally considered that processing can reduce toxicity and reinforce [ 19]. Adjuvant medicines are frequently used in processing. Wheat bran is one of the most commonly used adjuvant medicines.
